meanings.definition: The quality or state of being immovable.
meanings.sent1: The immovabilities of the massive boulder made it impossible to push.
meanings.sent2: The immovabilities of the ancient statue impressed the archaeologists.
meanings.sent3: Despite their best efforts, the immovabilities of the stubborn door frustrated the movers.
meanings.sent4: Her determination had an immovability that inspired everyone around her.
meanings.sent5: The mountain's immovabilities stood as a testament to nature's strength.

meanings.definition: The inability to be moved or changed.
meanings.sent1: The immovabilities of the heavy safe made it a challenge to relocate.
meanings.sent2: The immovabilities of his beliefs made it hard for him to consider other perspectives.
meanings.sent3: The immovabilities of the old tree stump amused the children trying to uproot it.
meanings.sent4: The immovabilities of tradition clashed with the winds of change.
meanings.sent5: The immovabilities of the glacier symbolized time's unyielding march.
